title: Understand the Problem
text: When you see a binomial expression like $${\left(4x-3y\right)}^5$$, it means you're being asked to expand it using the binomial theorem. This theorem gives us a formula to expand expressions of the form $${\left(a+b\right)}^n$$.

title: Identify Coefficients and Exponents
text: The Binomial Theorem involves terms of the form C(n,k)a**(n-k)b**k, where C(n,k) are the binomial coefficients, a and $$b$$ are terms from your binomial expression, and $$n$$ is the power you're raising the binomial to.

title: Calculate Binomial Coefficient for $$k=0$$
text: Calculate $$C(5,0)$$, the coefficient for the first term. What is the result?

title: Expand the First Term
text: Every term in the expansion follows the pattern where you raise (4x) to the power of $$(n-k)$$ and $$(-3y)$$ to the power of k. The first term involves $$k=0$$.

title: Calculate the First Term
text: Given that $$k=0$$, calculate the first term, which is $$1{\left(4x\right)}^5 {\left(-3y\right)}^0$$. What do you get?

title: Calculate Binomial Coefficient for $$k=1$$
text: Now calculate $$C(5,1)$$ for the next term. What is this coefficient?

title: Apply Binomial Pattern for Next Term
text: In the next term, use the pattern $${\left(4x\right)}^{n-k} {\left(-3y\right)}^k$$ with the values for $$k=1$$.

title: Calculate the Second Term
text: Calculate the value of the second term: $$5{\left(4x\right)}^4 {\left(-3y\right)}^1$$. What do you find?

title: Proceed with Remaining Terms
text: Continue applying the pattern for each k from $$0$$ to $$5$$ to find the complete expansion.
